pageContext.description: Part of hilt. Two rivet holes, below the second is a slight central thickening; slight flanges along the edge. The whole is slightly bent.
pageContext.associations: Part of a large hoard; see card for first sword fragment.
pageContext.publications: Arch. Journ. XXX 278,Evans,Jessup, Arch. of Kent, 107,Journ. Anthrop. Instit. III, 230
pageContext.site: England,Kent,Saltwood,Hayne Wood, on line of railway cutting 6 ft. below surface, lying on stratum of sand, c. 25 yards NE by N of summit of hill. Found June 4, 1872
pageContext.toSearch: Saltwood, Hythe, Hythe, Kent Ct21, UK
